1_Name of initiative: South- South and Triangular Cooperation in DRR
2_Brief description: South- South and Triangular Cooperation in DRR facilitate Angola’s access to regional and global knowledge sharing on Disaster Risk Management.

1_Name of initiative: Empowering Angolan Women - gender project in partnership with Minstry of Family and Women Promotion
2_Brief description: With UN Women’s ESARO, regional gender budgeting best practices and experiences were shared with high levels policy makers. Gender empowerment tools and manuals were developed and disseminated widely in partnership with Portuguese government and the Commission for Citizenship and Gender Equity and relevant authorities. Four senior MINFAMU staff gained gender expertise and knowledge and management skills from Brazil and Italy for mainstreaming gender issues into national development programmes.

1_Name of initiative: MISSION D’APPUI AU MINISTERE DE LA FONCTION PUBLIQUE DU BURUNDI DANS LA MISE EN ŒUVRE DE L’ARCHIVAGE ELECTRONIQUE DES DOSSIERS DES FONCTIONNAIRES ET AGENTS DE LA FONCTION PUBLIQUE
2_Brief description: Mission d’assistance technique de deux experts du Ministère de la Fonction Publique du Burkina Faso au profit du Ministère de la Fonction Publique du Travail et de la Sécurité Sociale du Burundi pour: (i)  partager l’expérience burkinabè en matiere de digitalisation et de sécurisation des archives et (ii) aider le Burundi à développer une feuille de route en vue d'un archivage électronique des dossiers des agents publics de l'Etat dans un horizon de 5 ans .

1_Name of initiative: Professionnalisation de la Magistrature Burundaise
2_Brief description: LE PNUD A SOUTENU LA MISE EN PLACE D’UN PARTENARIAT ENTRE LE CENTRE DE FORMATION PROFESSIONNELLE DE LA JUSTICE DU BURUNDI ET L’ECOLE NATIONALE D’ADMINISTRATION ET DE LA MAGISTRATURE DU MALI, DANS LE CADRE DE LA FORMULATION ET DE L’OPERATIONNALISATION D’UN PLAN DE FORMATION CONTINUE DES MAGISTRATS BURUNDAIS.

1_Name of initiative: ’PLAN DIRECTEUR INNOVANT POUR GUIDER LE DEVELOPPEMENT A VENIR DE LA CAPITALE DU BURUNDI’’
2_Brief description: Elaborer le Plan strategique directeur de Bujumbura 2015 (Bujumbura et ses environs)

1_Name of initiative:
Le South-South Global Assets and Technology Exchange (SS-GATE)
Developpement communautaire a travers le programme Territoire d’Apprentissage Territorio de Aprendizaje La deuxième Route d’Apprentissage–entreprenariat des jeunes en Colombie
2_Brief description: le 29 Juillet, 2014, le projet d’appui a la  mise en place du Business Promotion Center a signe un accord avec le  SS- GATE pour accueillir le centre de transfert de technologie Sud-Sud en faveur des PMA , afin de  permettre le transfert Sud-Sud de technologies viables, sectorielles visant a developper et renforcer les capacites et la production dans les PMA

1_Name of initiative: VISITE DE SYSTEMES D’ALERTE PRECOCE EXISTANTS ET FONCTIONNELS AU KENYA
2_Brief description: Renforcement des capacites  des pays les moins avances pour contrer les effets nefastes des changements climatiques a travers la formulation et la mise en œuvre du Plan National d’Adaptation aux changements climatiques. L’objectif etait le transfert de connaissances et de competences a travers les echanges en profitant des experiences des pays invites.

1_Name of initiative: APPUI A LA FORMULATION DES PLANS NATIONAUX D’ADAPTATION (PNA) AUX EFFETS NEFASTES DES CHANGEMENTS CLIMATIQUES (CC)
2_Brief description:
Renforcement des capacites des pays les moins avances pour contrer les effets nefastes des CC a travers la formulation et la mise en œuvre du Plan National d’Adaptation aux CC.
L objectif etait le transfert de connaissances et de competences en profitant des experiences des pays invites.

1_Name of initiative: le benin a reçu deux delegations d’experts venus de la cote d’ivoire et du mali qui se sont interessees au programme d’appui a la bonne gouvernance et a la consolidation de la democratie a travers la mise en œuvre du mecanisme africain d’evaluation par les pairs (maep).
2_Brief description:
les missions reçues au benin avaient pour but de s’inspirer de l’experience beninoise de mise en œuvre du mecanisme africain d’evaluation par les pairs (maep) dans ses phases d’autoevaluation, d’evaluation et de suivi de la mise en œuvre du plan national d’action.
- le deplacement des membres de la cng-maep au mali s’inscrit dans le cadre d’une rencontre faisant le point annuel de la mise en œuvre du maep et un renforcement des capacites de ces membres sur le controle citoyen.

1_Name of initiative: Cadre de concertation des Secrétariats Exécutifs/Secrétariats Permanents CNLS de la zone UEMOA et de la Mauritanie.
2_Brief description: Renforcer la concertation entre les deux structures sur des thématiques communes et sur les aspects de gouvernance de la réponse au VIH. Redynamisation du cadre de concertation des Secrétariats Exécutifs/Secrétariats Permanents CNLS de la zone UEMOA et de la Mauritanie dont le Burkina assure le secrétariat depuis sa mise en place en 2008.

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d’étude de la Mauritanie sur le Programme  National de Volontariat du Burkina (PNVB)
2_Brief description: En decembre 2014, une mission gouvernementale de la Mauritanie a sejourne au Burkina dans le cadre d’un voyage d’etude et d’echange d’experience sur la gestion du Programme  National de Volontariat du Burkina pour s’inspirer de l’experience du Burkina sur sa mise en œuvre et son ancrage institutionnel. Un partenariat entre les deux pays va etre cree pour mutualiser les experiences sur la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes.

1_Name of initiative: Certificat de Gouvernance Locale des Zones Humides
2_Brief description: Ce partenariat offre un programme de formation continue aux acteurs des collectivités territoriales et des structures techniques des capacités pour améliorer la valorisation des zones humides pour la résilience des communautés.

1_Name of initiative: Programme d'Appui aux Parcs de l'Entente (PAPE) couvrant Benin, Burkina Faso et Niger
2_Brief description: L’objectif du programme est de renforcer durablement la conservation des écosystèmes du complexe WAP (W, Arly, Pendjari) dans une perspective régionale et avec optimisation des bénéfices pour la population riveraine. Il est mis en œuvre dans 3 pays (Bénin, Burkina Faso, Niger) et sous forme de 3 composantes. Le PNUD, avec le BP/Burkina comme chef de file met en œuvre la composante 2 : Renforcer les institutions nationales pour une gestion coordonnée des aires protégées du complexe WAP.

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d’étude du Premier Ministère au Gabon
2_Brief description: Dans le cadre de l’appui à la mise en œuvre du programme de renforcement des capacités du Premier Ministère, il était prévu dans la première quinzaine du mois de novembre 2014 un voyage d’étude au Gabon.

1_Name of initiative: Strengthened capacity of Judicial Officers on non-litigation settlements of labour disputes in line with international labour standards and trends that encompass human right issues
2_Brief description: The initiative was a benchmarking mission to Zambia by three judges of the Industrial Court of Botswana. Its purpose was to study Zambia’s Court Annexed mediation and alternative dispute resolution mechanisms and draw lessons to inform Botswana’s development of its own alternative dispute resolution mechanisms.

1_Name of initiative: South-south and triangular cooperation
2_Brief description: Three countries had sought Botswana’s assistance: Malawi on anti-corruption, Liberia on tertiary education and the management of extractives and South Sudan on the management of extractives and anti-corruption campaign. A forensic audit of the Malawi treasury was recommended and approved following exchange missions. Funding was secured from the UK. Exchange missions took place in the case of both Liberia and South Sudan.  Botswana assigned a Policy Advisor to the Presidency in South Sudan.

1_Name of initiative: Echange d experiences et de participation a la quatrieme Assemblee Generale de la  Kigali International Conference  Declaration – KICD;  au Rwanda - 22 novembre au 01 decembre 2014
2_Brief description: Le bureau pays a favorise une mission de cooperation entre la Cote d’Ivoire et le Rwanda, qui a permis aux acteurs nationaux de securite ( police, gendarmerie, conseil National de securite, Ministere de l’interieur, Assemblee nationale) de s’impregner des bonnes pratiques de ce pays en matiere surtout de strategies et d’indicateurs de performance policiere et de controle democratique de l’action des forces de police.

1_Name of initiative: initiative ART Gold a ete entame par le Bureau en partenariat avec la Commune de Yaounde 7, la Municipalite de Malaga, et les communes au Maroc, en Tunisie et en Mauritanie.
2_Brief description: Dans le cadre de cette cooperation, il s'agira de contribuer à l’amelioration du fonctionnement et de la qualite des services aux citoyens de la commune de Yaounde 7  par l’introduction des TIC à travers  l'équipement d’un réseau informatique et des applications de gestion.

1_Name of initiative: Regional Policy for Universal Access to Modern Energy Services and Economic and Social Development”
2_Brief description: This joint ECCAS-CEMAC initiative, which aims to formulate a strategic framework or “White Paper” highlighting the relation between access to energy and sustainable development, constitutes the response.of the Regional Community to the needs of the populations in its ten (10) Member States in terms of universal access to modern energy services, renewable energy development and energy efficiency.

1_Name of initiative: La gestion et la preservation des eaux dans le bassin du lac Kivu et de la riviere Ruzizi
2_Brief description: Depuis de nombreuses annees, le PNUD appuie la resilience des populations, par des ecosystemes sains. Ainsi, lier les deux bassins ABAKIR et ALT (Autorites; du lac Tanganyika) debouche  sur une approche origionale coordonnee pour lutter contre la guerre de l’eau et d'elargir et de renforcer le cadre de cooperation et collaboration entre l’ABAKIR et ALT dans la perspective d’une gestion origionale du bassin des eaux du lac Kivu et de la riviere Ruzizi.

1_Name of initiative: Projet Parlement pour le climat
2_Brief description: L initiative vise l’échange de bonnes pratiques entre pays du sud afin de promouvoir le développement des énergies propres et renouvelables dans le cadre de la lutte contre les changements climatiques. Le PNUD a servi d'interface entre la pays et appuyé les activités.

1_Name of initiative: Centre de contrôle inter-pays (Cameroun-Congo-Gabon)
2_Brief description: Le centre vise a lutter contre le braconnage des espèces menacées. Le PNUD a facilité la coopération entre les pays impliqués ainsi que la mise en oeuvre des activités du projet.

1_Name of initiative: Amelioration du reseau national d’observation du temps a travers un etat des lieux des dispositifs et systemes de telecommunication existants
2_Brief description: Etat de lieu sur les infrastructures existantes et proposer des solutions adequates sur l’interconnexion entre la Direction de la Meteorologie et les autres institutions en charge des observations climatiques et meteorologique en altitude (etat des lieux des systemes-acquisitions, transferts et traitement des donnees ; Evaluation des besoins en Equipements ; plan de renforcement des capacites de l’ANACM)

1_Name of initiative: Developpement de la recherche sur le Eulemur Mongoz dans le cadre de la mise en oeuvre du programme sur les aires protegees en Union des Comores.
2_Brief description: Definir les axes de partenariats et de collaboration technique pour le developpement et la mise en œuvre d’un programme de protection de l Eulemur mongoz en Union des Comores en vue de sa conservation in situ ainsi que sa valorisation en tant que partie integrante du potentiel eco touristique.

1_Name of initiative: Options des politiques pour un programme de transfert sociaux
2_Brief description:
Programme de Transfert Social realise conjointement avec IPC-IG (International Partenariat avec le Policy Centre for inclusive growth et IPEA Instituto de Pesquisa Economico Aplicada, dont le but est de presenter des options pour un programme de transferts sociaux au Cabo Verde.
Une forte cooperation triangulaire fut developpée avec les institutions du  Bresil qui ont mené les analyses relatives au programme de transferts sociaux

1_Name of initiative: SIDS DOCK
2_Brief description: Encadres dans l’Alliance des petits Etats insulaires (AOSIS), SIDS DOCK c’est un mecanisme institutionnel collectif pour assister la transformation des secteurs energetiques en catalyseurs d’un developpement durable et appuyer la mobilisation de ressources.

1_Name of initiative: Gouvernance, politiques de gestion des ressources marines et reduction la pauvrete dans l’Ecoregion WAMER
2_Brief description: Cabo Verde participe au projet régional de Gouvernance, politiques de gestion des ressources marines et réduction la pauvreté dans l’Ecoregion WAMER. La D.G. des Ressources Marines et la D.G. de l’Environnement participent aux rencontres techniques contribuant au partage de meilleures pratiques et implémentent des activités nationales qui contribuent à la définition d’un cadre régionale pour la fiscalisation de la pêche et protection des environnement côtières et ressources marines

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des capacites de negociations des conventions sur le changement climatique
2_Brief description: L’objet de ce projet promu par Barbados e l’OECS et de renforcer les capacites de negociation ainsi que la comprehension des mecanismes de negociation dans le cadre des negociations et conventions sur le changement climatique.

1_Name of initiative: Gestion integree des ressources en eau et la gestion de l’eau residuelle
2_Brief description: Cabo Verde, a travers la D.G de l’Environnement dans ce projet SIDS/GEF/UNPD/UNEP d appui la gestion integree des ressources en eau et la gestion de l’eau residuelle. Des actions pilotes sont conduites au niveau pays pour le recyclage des eaux usees dans l’agriculture. Les actions regionales permettent l echange d’experiences pour la promotion d’un cadre legislative, institutionnel et politique pour la gestion integree des ressources en eau dans les petits pays insulaires.

1_Name of initiative: Inclusion Social des jeunes
2_Brief description: En 2013 Cabo Verde a  bénéficié des fonds de la Match contre la pauvreté de l’UNDP pour développer un projet d’inclusion social des jeunes et renforcement des capacités des communautés. Ce projet favorise le partenariat Sud-Sud au niveau de la communauté et le transfert des technologies social innovantes de l'ONG brésilienne "Afro Reggae" aux ONG du pays.

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des Capacités de l'Administration Publique
2_Brief description: Dans le cadre de la mise en place du système de renforcement des capacités des fonctionnaires de l'Administration Publique, une coopération avec l’institution brésilienne spécialisée en gestion de l'Administration Publique (FUNDAP) a été définie. Les institutions nationaux impliquées sont le Secrétariat d’Administration Publique et la Direction National de planification.

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des capacités des Cours de Comptes
2_Brief description: Promotion des échanges d’expériences avec paires visant le renforcement des Cour des Comptes.

1_Name of initiative: 1. Surface Water Management  Study Tour to Swaziland by seven staff from Water Resource Department  and the regions
2_Brief description: Swaziland and Eritrea are semi-arid and face similar challenges to water access.  Swaziland has a well developed surface water management system. Hence, the Government undertook a study tour to learn and apply their good practices (water works structures, waste water treatment plant, climate change adaptations practices, large Reservoirs management) in water use and management.

1_Name of initiative: Women International Symposium on Peace and Economic Empowerment
2_Brief description: Eritrea has a rich history of women involvement in peace building and economic empowerment which is locally documented but not acknowedged and shared internationally.  The symposium was organized to contribute to the global movement of post Beijing and to create a platform to share Eritrea's unique experience and to learn from other countries' practices.

1_Name of initiative: Ethio-China cooperation on DRR and dryland management
2_Brief description: The Ethio-China cooperation aims to enhance Africa-China S-S Cooperation on integrated climate change adaptation & DRM, strengthening resilience in the fields of, inter alia, anti-desertification & drought risk management, and sustainable natural resource management.

1_Name of initiative: National coffee platform initiative - experience sharing visit to Guatemala and Costa Rica on best implementation of the National Coffee Platform programme.
2_Brief description: The major objective was to gain experience from the pineapple and coffee platforms in Costa Rica and Guatemala respectively. The visit in particular tried to see how policy initiatives and regulations on quality enhancement and sustainability of coffee export could be addressed through the establishment of a coffee platform.

1_Name of initiative: Study visit to India and Kenya on cook stove technology in the framework of Energy4All.
2_Brief description: 13 high-level government officials from central and regional government made a study trip to India to learn about different aspects of cook stove technology (technological developments, institutional set-up, private sector engagement, R&D) as part of the Energy4All initiative. A second study visit took place to Kenya on detailed technological training around cook stove technology (ToT).

1_Name of initiative: Development of input-output coefficient system under the industrial development programme
2_Brief description: The major objective of the South-South initiative was to enhance the industrial coherence and to improve industrial planning through the systematization of incentives given in prioritized export oriented sub-sectors.

1_Name of initiative: study visit to Ghana on peace architecture
2_Brief description: A delegation composed of government, the Interreligious council and religious leaders made a study trip to Ghana to learn about Ghana’s peace structures as a good practice that will help the government and UNDP develop a robust peace architecture for Ethiopia that would embrace mechanisms for dealing with ethnic religious and political conflicts.

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des capacités des cadres du Ministère de l’Energie pour l’élaboration d’un Projet pilote d’accès à l’energie en milieu rural
2_Brief description: Sur requête du Ministère de l’Energie, le Bureau a mobilisé le Mali pour accompagner le Gabon dans  l’élaboration d’un Projet pilote d’accès à l’énergie pour sa politique énergétique en milieu rural. L'initiative va permettre Mali d'accompagner la mise en oeuvre du projet d'accès à l'énergie en milieu rural. En 2014 l'équipe du Mali a formé 5 cadres de la Direction des énergies et les accompagner pour mener 2 études de faisabilité participative ainsi que le dimensionnement de 2 projets.

1_Name of initiative: China-Ghana South-South Cooperation on Renewable Energy Technology Transfer project
2_Brief description: The project aims to facilitate the development and transfer of renewable energy technologies from China to Ghana along with the support required to make the technologies effective, including capacity building, transfer of know-how and best practices. The project will operate both at the upstream level (supporting the creation of an enabling environment for technology transfer) and downstream level (actual transfer and demonstration of technologies with potential upscaling by the private sector).

1_Name of initiative: Economie du changement climatique
2_Brief description: Missions de formation/echange experience a Addis Abeba portant sur economie du changement climatique. Prise en compte de economie du changement climatique dans programme et politique

1_Name of initiative: Elaboration des plans nationaux d’adaptation au changement climatique.
2_Brief description: Missions de Formation/ partage experience sur elaboration plan nationaux adaptation changement climatique. Deux cadres nationaux formes sur outils et methodes  pour elaborer des plans strategiques adaptation au changement

1_Name of initiative: Mise en place du Forum des femmes parlementaires de Guinee
2_Brief description: Suite a installation de Assemblee nationale, les femmes elues ont exprime le besoin de se constituer en reseau. Pour ce faire, le PNUD a apporte une assistance pour la venue de 3 femmes deputes du Burundi et de la Cote Ivoire en vue de partager leurs experiences dans ce domaine

1_Name of initiative: Integrated Entrepreneurship and Enterprise Development Project (EMPRETEC).
2_Brief description: Since the informal sector is the biggest employer, promotion of MSME and entrepreneurship is key to ensuring youth employment. With the support of EMPRETEC-Ghana, CO has finalized and signed a new project document, “Entrepreneurship and Enterprise Development” with the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Employment to support employment creation especially among women and youth.

1_Name of initiative: Multifunctional Platforms (MFP).
2_Brief description: The Gambia is part of the regional energy access for all project in which the country is piloting 5 Multi-functional platforms. CO facilitated the visit of energy officers and local community members to Senegal to learn from their wealth of experience as pioneers of the programme. Lessons learnt are being implemented to improve access to energy and further reduce domestic chores of women and girls in rural off-grid communities.

1_Name of initiative: Songhai Centre –Benin.
2_Brief description: A visit by the Ministers of Youth and Agriculture to the Songhai Centre in Benin facilitated by the CO provided opportunity to study the centre’s integrated sustainable agricultural development strategy for employment creation and poverty reduction. As a result of this ministerial study tour, a project document based on the Songhai strategy has been formulated and approved by cabinet.

1_Name of initiative: Projet Appui a la rehabilitation des rizieres et le traitement des produits agricoles et animaux
2_Brief description: Le projet vise a contribuer a  la qualite de vie des communautes en reduisant la pauvrete; et la faim.

1_Name of initiative: Projet d electrification rurale en utilisant des systemes d energie solaire
2_Brief description: Le projet vise a contribuer a  la qualite de vie des communautes en reduisant la pauvrete; et possiblitant l access a l energie solaire durable

1_Name of initiative: Mission d etudes du Gouvernement dans 3 pays (Mozambique, Mali et Benin)
2_Brief description: Elle avait pour objet pour l equipe de la fonction de publique d aller s enquerir des experiences  en reformes de l administration publique des 3 pays pour redynamiser le processus de reforme au niveau de la Guinee Bissau.

1_Name of initiative: Equatorial Guinea Poverty Profile Road Map
2_Brief description: High level technical advice for drafting the country's new National Poverty Profile was provided to the Ministry of Economics and Planning by the National Statistics Institute of Mexico.

1_Name of initiative: Collaboration between UNDP Rwanda and UNDP Kenya on Human Development Course.
2_Brief description: Kenyatta University and Pavia University in Italy developed a Master’s course on Economic and Human Development aimed at building a pool of experts with human development skills to advocate for the mainstreaming these components in policies and programme. The Rwanda CO contacted Kenya CO to organize a 5-day study tour to meet with key partners supporting the initiative. The composition of the Rwanda mission included UNDP, University and Government Representatives.

1_Name of initiative: 17 police officers (13 male and 4 female) were trained in Ghana for 8 weeks. The Constitution Review Committee (CRC) of Liberia toured two Constitution Review bodies in 2014. (The Constitution Review Implementation Commission -CRIC of Ghana and the Kenya National Commission on Human Rights-KNCHR
2_Brief description: The initiatives enhanced the capacity of the various institutions participating in these exchanges in affording exposure, forging partnerships, drawing lessons and learning best practices, with potential to be applied in the country. Since their return for example, the members of the CRC have spearheaded a public consultations exercise countrywide collecting views of citizens. The image of the police is changing as a result of exposure to client-oriented policing.

1_Name of initiative: training and capacity building
2_Brief description: The initiatives enhanced the capacity of the various institutions participating in these trainings in forging partnership, learning best practices to be applied to the country’s development agenda.

1_Name of initiative: Sustainable Land Management (SLM) programme, GEF supported project.
2_Brief description:
SLM is implementing the sustainable land management model in the Semonkong area of Lesotho. The SLM model is implemented in other African countries, and the cooperation between them is crucial to sharing best practices and lessons learnt to improve the model and viable implementation approaches thereof. 
UNDP Lesotho organized a regional knowledge sharing conference to ensure that SLM models can benefit from regional experiences. A publication was compiled, accessible to SLM practitioners.

1_Name of initiative: Public Sector Reform  - Performance Management for the public service
2_Brief description:
The Public Service Reform is built using best practices and expertise of other developing countries that have functioning public performance management systems. UNDP facilitated the exchange & analysis of models in Kenya on public sector reform, specifically on the performance management system in public service.
After analysis, a Kenyan expert from GoK was selected to support the GoL to implement the performance management system (initially as Gov2Got support, then longer term consultancy.

1_Name of initiative: Integration du Reseau MAD AIDS et de AFEP (Association des femmes positves), membre de MAD AIDS de Madagascar dans le reseau RAVANE OCEAN INDIEN et FEMMES OCEAN INDIEN POSITIVES
2_Brief description: Partage des informations, donnees et experiences pour lutter contre le VIH/SIDA dans l’Ocean Indien. En plus de l'organisation du voyage, l'appui du PNUD a consiste entre autre i) a mettre en relation les OSC malgaches et les reseaux en question, ii) a former les OSC malgaches sur des themes tels que le role des OSC dans la lutte contre le VIH, la discrimination et la stigmatisation pour un leur permettre de participer activement aux activites des reseaux.

1_Name of initiative: MISSION D’ECHANGE SUR LES EXPERIENCES TOGOLAISE ET SUD AFRICAINE DANS LA CONDUITE DE LA RECONCILIATION NATIONALE
2_Brief description: Les visites avaient pour but de s’enquerir des experiences et bonnes pratiques en matiere de processus de reconciliation nationale au Togo et en Afrique du sud. L'appui du PNUD a consiste a la mise en relation et a la preparation technique de la partie malgache a mieux dialoguer avec la partie togolaise. Les representants de la Presidence, Primature, Assemblee Nationale, Conseil de Reconciliation et Ministere de la Communication y ont participe.

1_Name of initiative: Visite de la delegation togolaise a Madagascar dans le cadre de la mise en place de la base de donnees sur la gestion des aides (AMP).Le PNUD a aide la partie malgache a la preparation technique de la mission (le contenu de la mission).
2_Brief description: Suite a un appui du Secretaire Technique Permanent en charge de la Coordination de lAide (Madagascar) aupres du Togo en 2013, une delegation togolaise est venue a Madagascar pour renforcer ses capacites dans la gestion de la base de donnees sur le suivi des aides grace a la transmission de savoir-faire des equipes malgaches en charge de la base (AMP) pour le pays.

1_Name of initiative: Partenariat entre l’Observatoire du Développement Humain du Maroc et celui du Mali
2_Brief description: L’Observatoire du Développement Humain du Mali a participé à l’invitation de l’Observatoire du  Maroc, à la Conférence sur les méthodes de mesure de développement humain et les approches d’évaluation axées sur l’équité en faveur des nouvelles générations. Le Directeur de l’ODHD a présenté la démarche d’élaboration de l’indice de pauvreté des communes du Mali. Un accord de partenariat est cours de conclusion entre les observatoires du Maroc et du Mali.

1_Name of initiative: Appui à  la Côte d’Ivoire pour l’organisation de la revue du Plan National de Développement
2_Brief description: La Cellule Technique CSLP a apporté un appui à la Côte d’Ivoire dans le cadre l’organisation et de la tenue de la première revue du Plan National de Développement (PND). A cette occasion, le Coordonnateur du CSLP a présenté l’expérience malienne des revues du CSCRP.

1_Name of initiative: Mission du Ministère du commerce de la Guinée au Mali sur l’expérience de la mise en oeuvre du cadre intégré
2_Brief description: Une mission d’échange du Ministère du Commerce de la Guinée, de l’Unité de mise en œuvre du Cadre intégré a séjourné en décembre  2014 à Bamako au Mali pour s’enquérir de l’expérience Malienne dans la mise en œuvre du Cadre intégré. La mission a rencontré les structures du gouvernement, du secteur privé et des partenaires pour s‘enquérir du diapositif institutionnel, organisationnel et résultats obtenus.

1_Name of initiative: Mission d’échange de deux membres du réseau citoyen pour la transparence budgétaire du Sénégal au Mali
2_Brief description: Deux membres du réseau citoyen pour la transparence budgétaire au Sénégal ont séjourné au Mali pour échanger avec le Groupe de Suivi Budgétaire du Mali sur le dispositif organisationnel, opérationnel, les relations avec l’exécutif et le parlement ainsi que avec les organes de contrôle, les mécanismes de financement, les modalités de coopération entre réseaux de l’espace de l’Union Economique Monétaire Ouest Africaine.

1_Name of initiative: Africa Regional Platform on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR)
2_Brief description: The 5th regional platform was held with the objective of reviewing the progress of DRR in Africa and consolidate the African contribution to the post-2015 framework for DRR towards eradicating poverty in Africa. Mozambique participation was led by the Ministry of Environment and contributed to share experiences and good practices and further strengthened government commitment on DRR for an increase of resources allocated to emergency responses. 53 African countries took part to the initiative.

1_Name of initiative: Echange de cooperation Sud-Sud avec le Maroc pour la mise en place de la base de donnees pour le casier judicaire, la Matrice de comptabilite sociale; ainsi qu'avec le Ghana pour la mise en œuvre du Cadre d'acceleration de l'OMD5
2_Brief description: Il s agit de sinspirer de l'experience marocaine dans le domaine de developpement des bases de donnees sur les personnes en conflits avec la Loi (casier judiciaire) et de la mise en palce des outils devaluation des politiques publiques; aisni que de tirer meilleur parti de lexpereince du Ghana en matiere d'amlioration de la snate maternelle

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d etude au Burkina Faso dans le cadre de la mise en oeuvre du Programme national de volontariat
2_Brief description: mission impliquant les structures nationales concernes par la mise en oeuvre du programme afin de s impregner des demarches entreprises par les autorites burkinabes dans le cadre de la mise en place de la structure nationale de volontariat (PNVB) et de s approprier les outils developpes, tirer les lecons des difficultes rencontrees et des actions prises pour les juguler.

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d etude au Burkina Faso sur l approche budget programme
2_Brief description: La Mauriatnie s apprete a utiliser l approche budget programme. Pour se donner les meilleures chances de succes, il est important d apprendre des pays qui utilisent deja cette approche. C est le cas du Burkina Faso qui est l un des pays de l Afrique de l Ouest ou cette approche est la mieux utilisee.

1_Name of initiative: “Support to Youth Employment Creation” Cote d’Ivoire
2_Brief description: CO facilitated participation of Senior Government official/employment specialist from Finance Ministry in a high-level expert mission to share Mauritius experience with the Cote d’Ivoire Government and assist in developing an Operational Action-Plan to ensure tangible results, strengthen institutional coherence and the relevance of the Ivory Coast Government’s interventions at the regional decentralized level, propose measures to promote youth employment and skills development.

1_Name of initiative: Pan-African Conference on Inequalities in the context of Structural transformation, Ghana, June 28-30, 2014
2_Brief description: CO mobilized funding and facilitated participation of senior Government Officials from Mauritius (Finance Ministry) and Seychelles (Social Affairs Division) in Conference organized by UNECA aimed at  promoting an African agenda to tackle inequalities and foster transformation; enhance understanding of the structural character and economic and social drivers of African inequalities and share knowledge of effective social, macro-economic and sectoral policies for addressing inequalities.

1_Name of initiative: Workshop on “Public Service Excellence and the Post-2015 Agenda” (PSP-2015)  organized by the UNDP Global Centre for Public Service Excellence, Singapore, 17-19 November, 2014
2_Brief description: CO mobilized funds/supported participation of Acting Financial Secretary in the workshop aimed at engaging participants on deploying the core themes of the GCPSE in the wider context of public sector reforms in developing countries, sharing current practices and debating challenges and opportunities, promote Learning Alliances on Public Sector Reform developed by the Effective Institutions Platform (EIP) to address such challenges and strengthen governance for delivering Post 2015 Agenda.

1_Name of initiative: Collaboration with IIT Madras
2_Brief description: The help of IIT Madras was sought to help in the development of the Coastal Engineering courses delivered at the University of Mauritius. Through the Adaptation Fund Board project, the local university was put in touch with IIT Madras for the development of specialised Masters levels courses. The UNDP project paid for the development of the handbooks and the visits to Mauritius by the Indian Experts.

1_Name of initiative: Joint Study Tour of Malawi and Gambia delegates on Mauritius experience in PBB and MTEF
2_Brief description: UNDP through its technical adviser to MOFED and SRM national consultant contributed to sharing the experience of Mauritius in developing results-based management and in setting up tools to improve the efficiency of social expenditure with senior budget and planning officers from Malawi and the Gambia in February 2014. The delegation from Malawi had received organizational and financial support from UNDP Malawi.

1_Name of initiative: Support to sharing Mauritius reform experience in High-level Brainstorming Meeting on Transforming Senegal into a Middle Income Country
2_Brief description: The IMF organized in December 2014 a high-level brainstorming meeting in Washington DC  to help implement the transformation plan of Senegal into a MIC (Plan Senegal Emergent) and share the experience of Cape Verde, Mauritius and Seychelles. UNDP contributed to sharing the experience of Mauritius in 5 specific areas through presentations facilitated by a senior Gvt official (budget reform, investment planning reform, PMS, client-oriented strategy in the public sector, SRM).

1_Name of initiative: Knowledge exchange trip - Strengthening technical support and cooperation in Renewable Energy Technologies
2_Brief description: The visit of the Seychelles  UNDP GEF PV project manager to Mauritius and interactions with the Mauritius UNDP GEF PV project helped the Seychelles Energy Commission gather information on capacity building, technical and legal aspects of PV. Following the visit the Seychelles Institute of Training developed a course for PV installers. The Seychelles project manager also attended high level technical training sessions under the Mauritius project while in Mauritius.

1_Name of initiative: Malawi Public Service Reform Commissioners Study Visits to Kenya, Singapore and United Kingdom (UK)
2_Brief description: These were benchmarking study visits to understand best practices in public sector reforms.  The tour, which was from September 8-19, 2014, involved six members from the newly constituted Public Service Reform Commission, UNDP and Public Sector Reforms Unit.  UNDP provided financial and technical assistance and study tour logistics and ensured the follow up.

1_Name of initiative: Study Tour to Mauritius on Programme Based Budgeting and Medium Term Expenditure Framework
2_Brief description: The overall objective of the study tour to Mauritius was to learn how Programme Based Budgeting (PBB) and Medium Term Expenditure Framework reforms work and understand pre-conditions necessary for implementation. The study tour was held from 10 to 20 February, 2014 and involved officials from the then Ministry of Finance and Ministry of Economic Planning and Development.  UNDP provided financial assistance and contact points to facilitate the tour.

1_Name of initiative: UNDP Malawi, UNDP China and the China Government in a Triangular Cooperation in the area of Disaster Risk Management and Resilience
2_Brief description: Under this cooperation, UNDP China initiated a call for concepts to support resilience-building initiatives at community level in Malawi to which UNDP Malawi successfully responded. Partnership discussions have been held through teleconferences and China team visited UNDP Malawi, MOFCOM and Malawi Government (DoDMA). An agreement is in its final stages with China providing US$500,000 for grants aimed at building community based resilience. This will be under the CO ongoing DRM programme.

1_Name of initiative: Africa Insider Mediators Platform (AIMP)
2_Brief description: The platform brings together peace practitioners and mediators (government, civil society) from across African with the aim of sharing best practice and experiences of successful mediation and peace building initiatives.  ACTION Support Centre with support from UNDP Regional Service Centre coordinates AIMP. UNDP supported 2 Public Affairs Committee officials and 2 UNDP staff to attend, and coordinated the data collection for existing infrastructures for peace in Malawi.

1_Name of initiative: The initiative was the Economic Association of Malawi (ECAMA) Annual Conference. ECAMA in collaboration with UNDP organized the annual conference in Malawi from 16 to 18 October 2014 with the theme “Achieving Inclusive Sustainable Economic Growth: From Rhetoric to Practice”.
2_Brief description: The conference explored long term strategies for sustainable economic growth in the next 50 year vision of Malawi from best practices from SADC countries that achieved growth. Attendance included: public service, academia, CSOs, and donors. Nikhil Treebhoohun, CEO Global Finance, Mauritius was invited to share success stories based on Mauritian model of economic diversification and how policies can be applied by Malawi Government to achieve industrial transformation.

1_Name of initiative: Implementation of the Benguela Current LME Action Program for Restoring Depleted Fisheries and Reducing Coastal Resources Degradation.
2_Brief description: UNDP-supported tripartite development initiative by Angola, Namibia and South Africa that aims to improve the use and management of marine resources.

1_Name of initiative: Support the review of the Environmental Impact Assessment for the Kazungula bridge with the view to mitigate the spread of HIV to adjacent countries (Zambia, Namibia, Botswana and Zimbabwe)
2_Brief description:
To strengthen regional cooperation on integrating CCIs in cross-border infrastructure projects using the Kazungula Bridge Project.
 To formulate standard operating procedures from developed guidelines for practical integration of HIV and Gender into EIAs.
To reach consensus on a common engagement framework for SADC or COMESA , with clarity on Division of Labor among Countries and Stakeholders on how to strengthen the integration of health, HIV, Gender and Human rights

1_Name of initiative: Formation des ONG intervenant dans le cadre des Plateformes Multi fonctionnelles
2_Brief description: Un expert du projet national de Plateformes Multifonctionnelles (PTFM) au Mali est venu au Niger pour dispenser une formation à 10 ONG, 1 bureau d’études et l’équipe du projet PTFM Niger en suivi évaluation des PTFM

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d’études au Sénégal au profit des experts du projet Africa Adaptation Programme (AAP) 2
2_Brief description: Deux experts du  Secrétariat Exécutif du Conseil national pour l’environnement et le développement durable (CNEDD) se sont rendus au Sénégal pour bénéficier de l’expérience de ce pays en matière d’assurance climatique en vue du développement d’un projet similaire au Niger

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d’échange d’expériences sur la prévention et la gestion des inondations à Ouagadougou des cadres du Gouvernorat de Niamey
2_Brief description: Quinze (15) responsables de la ville de Niamey, appuyés par le spécialiste des questions de prévention des crises et catastrophes du PNUD, se sont rendus à Ouagadougou pour un échange d’expériences et la visite de sites affectés par des inondations.

1_Name of initiative: Partage de l’expérience du Niger pour l’Installation d’une  base de données historiques des impacts des catastrophes et formation des cadres sur son utilisation au Mali.
2_Brief description: La base de données Desinventar est un outil de recueil des données historiques des impacts des catastrophes qui permet de développer le profil du pays en matière de catastrophes et de dégager des preuves d’impacts des catastrophes sur le développement. Cet outil est déjà opérationnel au Niger. Le spécialiste en prévention des crises et catastrophes du bureau a partagé l’expérience du Niger et appuyé l’installation d’une base de données similaire au Mali et formé les cadres à son utilisation.

1_Name of initiative: Voyage d’étude sur les bonnes pratiques en matière de modernisation de services publiques.
2_Brief description: Dans le cadre de l’appui du PNUD au Haut-Commissariat à la Modernisation de l’Etat (HCME), un voyage d’étude a été organisé du 22 au 30 Novembre 2014 au Rwanda, permettant à 2 cadres du HCME d’échanger sur les bonnes pratiques en matière de modernisation des services publiques.

1_Name of initiative: Learning Exchange for Nigerian Legislators, CSOs, NACA and Media on the Anti-Stigma legislation in Kenya
2_Brief description: The stakeholders were sponsored on a learning visit to the Kenyan Parliament and also interacted with CSOs, media at the forefront of developing and implementing the anti-stigma law in Kenya.

1_Name of initiative: Strategic planning, policy and operational capacities of INEC strengthened;ICT and Election Conference
2_Brief description: Peer learning and knowledge transfer on opportunities and limitations on ICTs in the electoral process

1_Name of initiative: Learning tour on police reforms in Rwanda by Ivory Coast and UNDP Governance Team in Ivory Coast.
2_Brief description: A delegation from UNDP Ivory Coast visited Rwanda in September 2014 to learn how to apply ICT innovations in their Police and GBV projects, by using mobile phone short text messages to address SGBV issues. Officials from the Government of Ivory Coast conducted a second exchange visit to Rwanda in November 2014 to share experiences on security policies, social cohesion and measuring performance in these areas, especially in terms of best practices and lessons learned from both countries.

1_Name of initiative: African Media Peer Review   Forum
2_Brief description: During the Regional Dialogue on Media Self Regulations, 12 African  Media self regulations institutions present formed an African Media Peer Review Forum to assess and  provide each other feedback, on an annual basis, focusing on the state of the media and self regulation in each country.

1_Name of initiative: Support for the Development of an Informal Sector Pension Scheme (ISPS) as a channel for long term savings mobilization and financial risk mitigation
2_Brief description: In December 2014 UNDP/UNCDF Inclusive Finance project team with the Rwanda Ministry of Finance conducted a study tour in India to learn 1) how the informal sector schemes are designed, 2) how they are functioning, 3) challenges encountered and 4) key success factors.  India was selected because of its registered success in implementing informal sector schemes. The expected output of the study tour is the development of a Pension Scheme for Informal sector.

1_Name of initiative: Experience sharing with Bangladesh Government on aid effectiveness agenda and best practices
2_Brief description: A delegation from Bangladesh Ministry of Finance visited Rwanda Ministry of Finance’s external Finances Unit in August 2014. The delegation team and the Rwanda counterpart shared their own experiences on aid management and how to manage its national aid effectiveness agendas.

1_Name of initiative: Exchange mission between University of Rwanda and Kenyatta University for Human Development based planning and teaching facilitated by both bureaus of UNDP Rwanda and Kenya
2_Brief description: An exchange visit between UNDP Rwanda and the University of Rwanda on one part and UNDP Kenya and Kenyatta University on the other was organized in order to share experience and learn from each other as how the Human Development paradigm is entrenched in national higher education curricula and planning.  The mission was held in November 2014.

1_Name of initiative: Cooperation between Burkina Faso and Rwanda on Poverty and Environment Initiative (PEI)
2_Brief description: PEI Burkina Faso conducted a study tour in Rwanda in September 2014. The objective was to learn about Environment and Natural Resources mainstreaming in the development agenda and to understand contribution of Green villages in the poverty reduction process.  The delegation took field visits in RUBAYA green villages and met with different Rwandan institutions involved in environment and natural resource management.

1_Name of initiative: GoWAMER  Gouvernance, politiques de gestion des ressources marines et reduction de la pauvrete dans l’Ecoregion WAMER  (Mauritanie, Senegal, Gambie, Guinee Conakry, Guinee Bissau et Cap-Vert)
2_Brief description: Le projet GoWAMER permet le partage d experiences sur  la gouvernance et l adoption de bonnes pratiques en matiere d utilisation durable des ressources marines et cotieres.

1_Name of initiative: Programme National Plateformes multifonctionnelles pour la lutte contre la pauvrete(PTFM)
2_Brief description: Le PTFM a suscité un partage d’expériences avec la Guinée qui a bénéficié de l’expertise en matière de micro industrialisation villageoise et de promotion de l'entreprenariat rural

1_Name of initiative: Programme Ecovillages
2_Brief description: L’initiative a pour objectif de capitaliser les leçons d’expériences du concept Ecovillage au profit des pays couverts par la Grande Muraille Verte

1_Name of initiative: Study Exchange between the Ugandan Electoral Commission and the National Electoral Commission (NEC) of Sierra Leone
2_Brief description: UNDP supported the hosting of a study tour between the Ugandan Electoral Commission and the National Electoral Commission (NEC) of Sierra Leone on “Political Participation of Persons with Disabilities” with a view to sustained relationship on capacity support and information exchange on electoral management.

1_Name of initiative: Sierra Leone - Ghana Media Collaboration
2_Brief description: A media delegation from Sierra Leone vsisted Ghana and interacted with the Ghana Broadcasting Corporation, Ghana Institute of Journalism, African College of Communication, UNESCO, Ghana Network of Community Radio Network and West Africa Media with a view to establish collaboration between the stakeholders in the media sector of the two countries.

1_Name of initiative: Strengthening women in Parliament and  gender equality and womens' empowerment.
2_Brief description: Chair of Women caucus attended the CPA workshop for Women Members in the Parliament of Ghana where cooperative efforts and information exchange with other development partners were pursued and established.

1_Name of initiative: IGAD Regional Initiative for Capacity Enhancement in South Sudan
2_Brief description: 200 Civil Service Support Offices drawn from Ethiopia, Kenya and Uganda were engaged to build South Sudan’s civil service capacity. 34 CSSOs from Phase 1 of the project were deployed to GRSS institutions. Phase 2 of the initiative began in 2014 with recruitment of 139 CSSOs who will be deployed to South Sudan in 2015

1_Name of initiative: Access to Justice and Rule of Law programme
2_Brief description: Through South-South cooperation with two sub-regional countries judges and prosecutors engaged with the Judiciary of Kenya and Directorate Public Prosecution of Uganda to benchmark best practice. In addition, experts drawn from the sub-region provided the substantive technical content for training on international criminal law and transitional justice

1_Name of initiative: Stratégie de co-financement pour la mise en œuvre du Programme de Réforme de la Justice
2_Brief description: Pour Timor-Leste, il y a eu une visite d’étude conduite par La Ministre de la Justice, le Procureur-Général de la République et le Président de la Cour Suprême ; Relativement au Brésil, les agents de la Police d’Investigation Criminelle (PIC) ont été outillés en techniques d’investigation et d’approche policières.

1_Name of initiative: Establishment of Youth Innovation Hub
2_Brief description: In September 2014, the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) and the Innovation Association of Swaziland (IAS) established partnership with Tshwane Innovation Hub in South Africa in the area of innovation development. Leveraging on the Innovation Fund, UNDP facilitated partnerships between the two countries to collaborate in this initiative.

1_Name of initiative: Piloting of Climate Change Adaptation initiative through Sand Dams technology -  Ministry of Natural Resources and Energy (MNRE) – Department of Water Affairs (DWA) - GoS.
2_Brief description: UNDP brokered partnerships between MNRE – DWA and the Africa Sand Dams Foundation (ASDF) of Kenya aimed at introducing CCA through community based water harvesting and storage infrastructure. In February 2014, officials from MNRE, Public Works and Agriculture were facilitated by UNDP to collaborate with ASDF on the sand dam’s technology.

1_Name of initiative: Integrated Water Resource Management Knowledge Sharing- GoS and the State of Eritrea Ministry of Land, Water and Environment (MLWE)
2_Brief description: The MNRE –DWA and MLWE cooperated in the area of Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) in December 2014. UNDP coordinated the team of 7 MLWE officials for a learning exercise, seeking to increase the technical knowledge and information on water governance and IWRM practices including strategies for the uptake of water saving technologies. This was hosted by the Swaziland Water Services Corporation a GOS Water Utility parastatal and DWA.

1_Name of initiative: Mission d appui d experts 3N initiee (LES NIGERIENS NOURRISSENT LES NIGERIENS) dans le cadre du processus de formulation des priorites de resilience/AGIR Sahel au Tchad
2_Brief description: Dans le cadre de l alliance Globale pour la initiative Resilience dans le Sahel(AGIR) au Tchad, le PNUD a appuye le deploiement des experts 3N du Niger au Tchad en vue d accelerer le processus de formulation des priorites nationales en matiere de resilience.

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des capacites en planification urbaine
2_Brief description: Visite d’echange et de capitalisation sur les bonnes pratiques de planification urbaine. Cette  visite a connu la participation des representants du ministere de l’urbanisme et de l’habitat, de la municipalite de Lome et de la prefecture du Golfe.

1_Name of initiative: Professionnalisation des services du Fonds National de Finance Inclusive
2_Brief description: Voyage realise aupres des cadres du Fonds National de la Microfinance pour etudier les modalites le financement des activites generatrices de revenus, la gestion du partenariat avec les prestataires de services financiers et la collecte des informations et des donnees sur les beneficiaires.

1_Name of initiative: Partage d’experience sur l’application informatique des chaines judiciaires
2_Brief description: Le PNUD a soutenu une rencontre de partage de l’experience du Senegal sur l informatisation des chaines judiciaires du 8 au 11 juillet 2014 a Lome. Cette activite a reuni des experts senegalais (du ministere de la justice, de l universite Cheikh Anta Diop et du Barreau) et leurs homologues togolais et vise a aider le systeme judicaire togolais a entamer le processus de son informatisation en vue d assurer la rapidite et la securite des decisions de justice.

1_Name of initiative: Renforcement des capacites des fonctionnaires de l Assemblee Nationale en matiere de controle  et de suivi de l execution budgetaire.
2_Brief description: Visite d echanges permettant aux fonctionnaires de la Cellule d Analyse du Budget National (CABAN) de l Assemblee Nationale de s impregner des modalites pratiques dans le cadre de la lecture, l examen et le vote de la loi de finance, de l effectivite du controle et du suivi de l execution budgetaire.

1_Name of initiative: Professionnalisation des services du Fonds national de Finance Inclusive
2_Brief description: Analyser aupres des autorites de tutelle et de controle en charge de la microfinance, des deux Fonds Nationaux de microfinance, des institutions de microfinance et des bailleurs de fonds des modalites d’accords et de gestion de partenariat avec les prestataires de services financiers.

1_Name of initiative: Learning management and technology for Fish farming (caging and ponds) between the Bunda district staff, CSO and Private Sector in Tz and Uganda/Kenya Govt; and again JKT-Govt Tz and Uganda Govt.
2_Brief description: Through PEI for pro-poor growth and environmental sustainability to promote sustainable fishing, curbing overfishing in the Lake Victoria, conserve ecosystem - a learning mission between Tanzania and Uganda/Kenya institutions took place in March 2014. UNDP provided financial, logistic and access to information. after the learning mission, fish farming initiative was launched in Dec. 2014 by Minister for Livestock & Fishery; another follow up learning JKT/Uganda took place in Dec. 2014.

1_Name of initiative: Establishing a Center for South-South Cooperation for better coordination and agreed by Government - PMO, MoF, MFA, POPC. The BRN was a result of Tz learning from Malaysia
2_Brief description: No single entity for SSC cordination in Tanzania. The initiative is intended to help the government to rectify the coordination gaps. Cabinet Secretariat (CS) learned from Kenya's Planning Commission; POPC learned from PEMANDU of Malaysia. The end results was to establishing a Center for SSC for better coordination among key institutions PMO, MoF, MFA, POPC and CS. The BRN/SSC resulted from POPC learning from Malaysia Big Fast Results. UNDP provided financial and search for SSC best practices.

1_Name of initiative: The EMBs i.e. NEC (Tz Mainland) and ZEC (Zanzibar) undertook staff professional development through BRIDGE  training programme and learning mission to Kenya's Electoral Commission and Mexico's Electoral Commission in using eletronic BVR for registration.
2_Brief description: UNDP supported EMBs (NEC & ZEC) learning mission to Kenya and Mexico. These created opportunities for peer learning and experience sharing especially on election management and reform between the two Tanzanian EMBs (NEC &ZEC) and their counterparts i.e. Electroal Commissions in Kenya and Mexico. UNDP provided financial support, identification of EMBs in Kenya and Mexico and logistic support.

1_Name of initiative: Through the Climate Change Africa Adaptation Initiative, Tanzania engaged with Ethiopia, Philippines and Kenya in addition to Community Based Adaptation Conference (CBA 8) in Nepal.
2_Brief description: Tanzania shared with Ethiopia experience on the establishment of CC financing mechanism; Tz shared with Philippines on institutional structure for CC; and Tz with Kenya on improving the national CC adaptation plan of actions; and Government officials participated in knowledge and experience sharing mission in Nepal to improve CC governance and mainstreaming in Zanzibar. (Ref. ADR 2014 and Project Progress Report.

1_Name of initiative: Regional DRR Platform and Integrated Climate Risk management Programme.
2_Brief description: CO supported Uganda’ representation to the UNDP-facilitated regional DRR platform and the Regional Climate and DRR meeting in Nepal. The DRR platform meetings provide the Governments opportunity to share  experiences on DRM, particularly, on the areas of tapping parliamentary support, climate change and adaptation and building community resilience.

1_Name of initiative: Economy-wide Modelling for Assessing Sustainable Development Policies
2_Brief description: UNDP facilitated a regional capacity building programme to support developing countries with integrated macro-micro modelling tools for generating scenarios and results to guide policymakers in the design of sustainable development policies and strategies.  This was achieved through a partnership with UNDESA that conducted similar capacity building exercises in other developing countries.  (SDM Mission Report, p1-3).

1_Name of initiative:
1.Capital freight reversal and development financing
2. Project management and financial resource mobilization
2_Brief description: The UNDP-funded initiative was to guide developing countries within East African region in building strong relationships with local, regional, and International development partners and be able to manage their freight, manage projects and their corresponding resources.

1_Name of initiative:
1. Performance based budgeting and public expenditure
2. Results Based management and performance indicators
2_Brief description: The  UNDP-funded initiative gave a guide to selected African countries, on identifying and managing risk while bearing in mind the expected results and necessary resources;increasing knowledge by learning lessons and integrating them into decisions; and reporting on the results achieved and resources involved. SSC will be promoted aimed at strengthening or establishing close ties with other policy research analysis institutions in the South, to share knowledge and to address issues that of a particular concern to the global South.

1_Name of initiative: Study tours to Malaysia and China on building a capable, career-oriented and Professional Public Service for a developmental state.
2_Brief description: A delegation of commissioners from the PSC were hosted by the government of China to expand their knowledge on building a capable, career-oriented and Professional Public Service for a developmental state. The process is further envisaged to inform public sector policy debates on a developmental state.

1_Name of initiative: Egyptian electoral study tour to South Africa on engendering the electoral process.
2_Brief description: The South African government hosted a high level delegation led by the Secretary General of Egypt's Supreme Electoral Commission and comprising representatives from the Egyptian Government, NGOs, Women Organizations, and UNDP Egypt to increase the understanding and awareness of gender mainstreaming in electoral administration to allow for integration of this learning into Egypt's upcoming parliamentary elections in March 2015.

1_Name of initiative: Study tour on Truth and Reconciliation Commission
2_Brief description: A delegation from Madagascar wanted to exchange experiences which the CO facilitated on South Africa's implementation and success in transitional justice particularly through the experience of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

1_Name of initiative: Development of autoclaves to be used in Ebola affected countries
2_Brief description: Autoclaves developed in South Africa through GEF programme were deployed with UNDP’s financial and logistical support in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone to safely dispose medical waste

1_Name of initiative: South to South Cooperation on integrating HIV and related gender aspects into capital projects using Environmental Assessments (EAs) as entry points
2_Brief description: Zambia and China have entered into a South to South Cooperation for promoting renewable energy (RE) technologies. Zambia will be supplied with appropriate technologies in RE while china will be learning from Zambia how to provide technical assistance for capacity development which could be replicated in other developing countries. The funding for implementing this initiative is from the Government of Denmark.

1_Name of initiative: South-to-South Cooperation on voting and electoral process technologies between Namibia and Zambia
2_Brief description: A Team from the Electoral Commission of Zambia (including software developers and elections staff) visited Namibia during the November Presidential Elections to learn and observe the first ever implementation of e-voting in Africa. This would in turn feed into the continuous development and full roll out of the Elections Information Management System that aims to deliver results to the public in 24 hours from 48 hours, for the 2016 Elections.

1_Name of initiative: Integrating crosscutting issues (CCIs)  in cross-border infrastructure projects using the Kazungula Bridge Project as a case study.
2_Brief description: UNDP Zambia organized a south to south engagement for Government Botswana, Namibia, and Zimbabwe. The objective of this cooperation was to share country and regional experiences on the status of integrating crosscutting issues (CCIs) particularly health, HIV and gender in the EA processes in accordance with the project phases and strengthen regional cooperation on integrating CCIs in cross-border infrastructure projects using the Kazungula Bridge Project as a case study.

1_Name of initiative: Southern Africa Regional Exchange Platform on the role of Dialogue for Inclusive community Peace and Reconciliation in Southern Africa
2_Brief description: This workshop provided a platform where key stakeholders from the Southern African region shared country-specific knowledge and experiences on the role of community dialogue for peace and reconciliation. Jointly hosted by ACCORD and ECLF, the participants were drawn from Government and Civil Society within the Southern African region.

1_Name of initiative: Study Visit to the Justice Law and Order Sector (JLOS) in Uganda
2_Brief description: JLOS representatives undertook an exchange visit to learn from the Ugandan model. Five departments in the Ministry of Justice, the Zimbabwe Republic Police, the Zimbabwe Prison and Correctional Services and UNDP undertook the mission under the leadership of the Deputy Minister for Justice. UNDP supported a technical expert to share the Ugandan experience as well as technical and financial support for the exchange visit.

1_Name of initiative: Study visit to Tanzania, Bangladesh and India on alternative financing for women
2_Brief description: Senior government, reserve bank officials and representatives from the Banking Sector conducted a study tour to Tanzania, Bangladesh and India were they were exposed to various micro-financing, special financing and women’s banks models. UNDP provided technical support in the development of a concept note, as well as financial support for the exchange visit.

1_Name of initiative: Study tour for 26 Zambian farmers on livelihoods and climate change adaptation 3-9 August 2014
2_Brief description: 26 Zambian farmers (19 males & 7 females) visited Zimbabwe 3-9 August 2014 to exchange experiences and share lessons and best practices from Zimbabwe on climate change adaptation practices and livelihoods. This was done through visits to a diversity of projects (small irrigation schemes, organic farming, environmental protection, water harvesting, beekeeping and honey processing, and tourism) throughout Zimbabwe and holding discussions with Zimbabwean farmers and officials.

1_Name of initiative: Preparation of strategy document for the establishment of Special Economic Zones (SEZ)
2_Brief description: UNDP was approached by the GoZ in mooting the idea of establishing SEZ. Accordingly, UNDP, in collaboration with the Office of the President and Cabinet, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other relevant ministries facilitated a high level knowledge sharing seminar in the area of SEZ with experts from China, Mauritius, South Africa and UAE. The experts shared their experiences in establishing SEZs in their respective countries and lessons to be leaned by Zimbabwe.

1_Name of initiative: Ethiopia Health and Nutrition Institute, EPHA, provided external technical support to the 2014 TB Prevalence Survey (TPS).
2_Brief description: Technical support to the implementation of the TPS

1_Name of initiative: UNDP Co provided technical support to UNDP Afghanistan in the development of a Concept Note (CN) for the Malaria Global Fund New Funding Model (NFM)
2_Brief description: Malaria Concept note (CN) in Afghanistan finalized and submitted to the Global Fund

1_Name of initiative: Livelihood Improvement in Tajik-Afghan Cross-border Areas (LITACA)
2_Brief description: A 3 years initiative to promote stability and security in the bordering provinces of Tajikistan and Afghanistan. This will be achieved by reducing poverty, supporting economic development and cross-border collaboration among the communities along the Tajik-Afghan border. Additionaly, the project will offer capacity development opportunities for the local governments, civil society and private sector organizations

1_Name of initiative: Afghan Police training at Sivas Police Training Academy
2_Brief description: Basic and advanced police training for male and female Afghan National Police Officers funded by Japan and provided through the SIVAS Training Center in Turkey with facilitation support from the Turkish Embassy. The SIVAS Training Center applies conditions for participation such as higher education.

1_Name of initiative: Exposure visits for Kandahar and Helmand SMEs under Rural Enterprise Development Programme.
2_Brief description: AREDP, RED KAN and HELMAND know-how trainings in New Delhi, India and Islamabad, Pakistan

1_Name of initiative:
Livelihood Improvement in Tajik-Afghan Cross-border Areas (LITACA) 
High Level Study Tour to visit the “One Village – One Product (OVOP)” Project in Kyrgyzstan
2_Brief description:
A High Level delegation representing LITACA project partners from Afghanistan and Tajikistan visited One Village One Product (OVOP)  successful model in Kyrgyzstan.

The delegation exchanged experiences with Kyrgyzstan officials and rural development practitioners and visited their OVOP initiative.

1_Name of initiative: Prototype on innovative urban service delivery
2_Brief description: Government representatives from Gazipur city partnered with the China International Poverty Reduction Center in an exchange design lab to prototype a one-stop social service center for urban locations. Bangladesh and China developed the prototype through exchange visits and experience sharing, based on the success of China’s one-stop-shop social service stations in urban areas. The mayors of five Bangladeshi cities attended the lab and endorsed the model to be replicated in their cities.

1_Name of initiative: Integrating Regional Human Rights Mechanism through the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC)
2_Brief description: The National Human Rights Commission, with UNDP technical and advisory support, brought together SAARC member states' human rights institutions to discuss establishing a regional mechanism to monitor human rights and to exchange experiences and challenges in promoting and protecting human rights. Bangladesh shared experiences in implementing the Prevention and Suppression of Human Trafficking Act; India shared lessons on the links between marriage registration and preventing child marriage.

1_Name of initiative: Sharing learning on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Change Adaptation (CCA)
2_Brief description: Officials from the Bangladesh Department of Disaster Management and Relief shared knowledge and lessons learned on disaster management and CCA with their counterparts from China and Nepal. A Bangladesh-hosted visit focused on flash flood early warning. A follow-up visit to China focused on disaster information management and earthquake risk management. Bangladesh also shared some of its best practices at the 6th Asian Ministerial Conference on DRR in 2014.

1_Name of initiative: Exchange on human trafficking and smuggling investigations
2_Brief description: Representatives from the Bangladesh Police and the Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Planning and the Economic Relations Division undertook an exchange visit to the Human Trafficking Investigation and Protection Center in the Philippines. Effective techniques for investigating human trafficking and special transnational crimes were shared, as well as support mechanisms for women and child victims (with additional expertise from the Australian Federal Police).

1_Name of initiative: South-South Asia Pacific Development Effectiveness Facility
2_Brief description: The Bangladesh Economic Relations Division in the Ministry of Finance created the Asia Pacific Development Effectiveness Facility (AP-DEF), a South-South knowledge sharing platform. With UNDP support, it facilitated peer exchanges with Laos, Papua New Guinea and the Philippines on development effectiveness. The Facility’s objective is to strengthen cooperation in addressing common regional challenges and to promote the ongoing exchange of tested and best practices on human rights issues.

1_Name of initiative: Establishing a rights-based life-cycle approach to social protection
2_Brief description: High- and mid-level representatives from the Bangladesh General Economic Division, Ministry of Planning undertook exchange visits to their counterparts in South Africa and Nepal, and applied the lessons learnt and best practices from these countries’ best social protection practices for the new Social Security Strategy.

1_Name of initiative: Experience sharing on Energy Efficient Standards (EESs), labelling and behaviour change
2_Brief description: Officials from the Bangladesh Ministry of Power, Energy and Mineral Resources are sharing experiences, lessons and expertise on energy efficiency standards, labelling and behaviour change with their counterparts in five Asian countries. The regional platform aims to advance progress in this area and includes participation from sector specialists and private-sector entrepreneurs. Technical Working Group Meetings occur semi-annually and a regional steering committee meeting is held annually.

1_Name of initiative: South-South Cooperation on Climate Risk Management (Glacial Lake Outburst Floods)
2_Brief description: Teams of Nepalese and Pakistani officials visited Bhutan to learn from Bhutan’s experience of implementing the Climate Change Adaptation project - “Reducing climate change-induced risks and vulnerabilities from glacial lake outburst floods in the Punakha, Wangdi and Chamkhar valleys.”

1_Name of initiative: China-Cambodia-UNDP Trilateral Cooperation Cassava Project Phase II
2_Brief description: The Cambodia cassava project Phase2 aims to bring benefits to cassava farmers by mobilizing knowledge and expertise mainly from China. Through a needs assessment, an environmental study, a training manual and a business-matching exercise, the project addressed challenges faced in the Cambodian cassava sector, promoting direct export of cassava to the Chinese market. The Trilateral cooperation project also supports Chinese bilateral assistance to focus on achieving poverty reduction objectives.

1_Name of initiative: China-India Low Carbon Study
2_Brief description: This Study, one of the first collaborative efforts between major research institutes in India and China working on climate change, was launched in March, 2013 at the China-India Strategic Economic Dialogue in Beijing. It examines low carbon technologies, research and development policies, and financing, in national and subnational contexts and identifies numerous areas for cooperation on low-carbon development including knowledge exchange, capacity building and training.

1_Name of initiative: China-Ghana South-South Cooperation on Renewable Energy Technology Transfer
2_Brief description: The project will ensure that 1) Ghana has an enabling environment in place for the transfer, 2) production and regulation of the use of Renewable Energy Technologies in Ghana, has and increased access to and use of relevant Renewable Energy Technologies (RETs) and 3) that China’s has strengthened capacity for South South Cooperation in relation to RET transfer.

1_Name of initiative: China-Zambia South-South Cooperation on Renewable Energy Technology Transfer
2_Brief description: The project will ensure that 1) the enabling environment for the transfer and use of priority renewable technologies is strengthened in Zambia, 2) market barriers to the adoption of renewable technologies for the rural poor are removed in Zambia, and 3) Chinese capacity for South South Cooperation on renewable energies is strengthened.

1_Name of initiative: China-Bangladesh Urban Solutions Lab
2_Brief description: The Lab applied design thinking methodology in south-south government-to-government knowledge sharing (Between China and Bangladesh) to adapt China’s one-stop-shop urban service centre model to the Bangladesh context. After a study tour and design thinking workshop in Beijing, a one-stop shop was prototyped in Bangladesh.

1_Name of initiative: Sharing and Learning on Community Based Disaster Management in Asia (CBDM Asia)
2_Brief description: Asia is one of the most disaster-prone region. Regional coordination and cooperation in disaster management in Asia is still far from adequate. The CBDM Asia Project aims at improving knowledge management of disaster risk, promoting experience sharing among the participating countries, and providing a bridge for governments, academia, and communities to engage in dialogues and collaboration. Bangladesh and Nepal are engaged in the project as partner countries.

1_Name of initiative: South-South Cooperation on Climate Change Forum
2_Brief description: The Forum brought together more than 200 participants including ministers and other government representatives from China, Egypt, Gabon, Mongolia, Nepal, and Seychelles, principals of UNEP, UNDP, UNFCCC, UNCCD, GEF, and SDC, heads of development agencies, scientists, business leaders, and civil society representatives to discuss the importance of South-South cooperation as a key element of the response to climate change, its enablers and constraints, and options and mechanisms for its promotion.

1_Name of initiative: Promoting Sustainable Development of Chinese Enterprises for “Going Out”
2_Brief description: This project is implemented by UNDP, Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation (CAITEC) under the Ministry of Commerce, and the Research Center of State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission (SASAC). It promotes overseas sustainable development of Chinese companies and corporate social responsibility through research and advocacy to improve companies’ capacity to respond to challenges in overseas operations and build trust with stakeholders.

1_Name of initiative: The 5th Africa-China Poverty Reduction and Development Conference
2_Brief description:
The Conference “Industrial Development: Cross-perspectives from Africa and China” was co-organized by the African Union Commission, the International Poverty Reduction Center in China, the Ministry of Industry of Ethiopia, and UNDP in November in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. 
More than 100 African government officials and representatives from organizations, including the African Development Bank, IMF, and UNIDO addressed African industrialisation strategies, and ideas for future action with China.

1_Name of initiative: Northeast Asia Regional Cooperation Programme and Support to the Greater Tumen Initiative (GTI)
2_Brief description:
With facilitation from UN RC & UNDP RR, the GTI “Concept Paper on Legal Transition” was endorsed by 4 member governments at the 15th GTI Consultative Commission Meeting in September. It lays the foundation for GTI to implement legal transition by 2016. 
The Northeast Asian EXIM Banks Association Inaugural Meeting was held back-to-back with the GTI meeting. The Association will provide needed capital into the Northeast Asian region, especially in basic infrastructure and transportation.

1_Name of initiative: Support to the second White Paper on China’s Foreign Aid
2_Brief description: In 2013 UNDP was asked by the Ministry of Commerce and Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation to provide inputs into the drafting of China’s second White Paper on Foreign Aid. In July 2014 the White Paper was released and a number of UNDP’s suggestions were found to be well incorporated. UNDP China also produced an analytical piece in the immediately following the release of the second White Paper in consultation with CAITEC counterparts.

1_Name of initiative: The 8th China-ASEAN Forum on Social Development and Poverty Reduction (7-8 August 2014)
2_Brief description: “Deepening ASEAN-China Regional Cooperation on Poverty Reduction” addressing regional cooperation for poverty reduction & social inclusion, good practices, and emerging new partners, was co-organized by Leading Group Office on Poverty Alleviation and Development/International Poverty Reduction Center in China & the Ministry of Livestock, Fisheries and Rural Development of Myanmar, supported by UNDP, the ASEAN Secretariat, China International Center for Economic and Technical Exchanges and ADB.

1_Name of initiative: Africa Umbrella Trilateral Cooperation Programme
2_Brief description: In 2014, the trilateral umbrella programme in Africa ($1 million  contribution from MOFCOM) led to the design of two trilateral  cooperation projects with Burundi (renewable energy) and Malawi (disaster management). The two new trilateral projects will be launched in Q1 of 2015. In December 2014, MOFCOM allocated an additional $1 million contribution for another two new trilateral cooperation projects to be designed and launched in 2015.
